summary:
The IMF is a global financial organization with 190 member countries, headquartered in Washington, D.C. Its main goals are to promote economic stability, support international trade, and reduce poverty. Established in 1944, it helps governments with financial difficulties and prevents economic crises.

Member countries contribute funds, allowing others to borrow during economic challenges. The IMF also analyzes economic data and provides policy advice. Currently led by Managing Director Kristalina Georgieva, it plays a crucial role in global economic management.
title: International Monetary Fund
